title: Pilot
description: It is getting a little crowded in the Rush Family's duplex row house. Sisters Jackie and Sara want to move out, but to the dismay of their father Henry because he doesn't like the idea of two young girls living in the big city by themselves. However, they might be headed to a win-win situation when Jackie and Sara contemplate on renting the apartment downstairs from their dad.

title: It Didn't Happen One Night
description: Sara goes on a trip to Lake Tahoe with her friends, and Henry panics after he inadvertently finds birth control pills in her room.

title: The Bag Lady
description: Henry and Muriel hire two ex-convicts to repair a damaged wall in their kitchen. Meanwhile, Jackie was tasked to deposit a large sum of money for her work at the bank. When the bank closes before she gets there, Jackie had to take the cash home. As a result, Henry tries to hide the cash, not wanting the ex-cons to spot it.

title: Tenants, Anyone?
description: Mildred Rafkin, the sister of the former tenant of Jackie and Sara's apartment, return to claim her late brother's belongings, including all the furniture. With an unfurnished apartment, the girls find another apartment to rent, albeit in a seedy and high-crime neighborhood.

title: Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolfe?
description: Sara is a new hire at Jackie's bank. Jackie is suspicious when her boss promotes Sara to a manager level position after only a week on the job.

title: Mister Big
description: Henry's comic book company is being acquired by Wainwright Publishings, and he thinks his job is in jeopardy when new boss Arthur Wainwright prefers to hire more youthful people.

title: The Location
description: Sara rents her apartment to a film crew for a movie, which involves live animals. Unfortunately, one of the animals, a male lion, escapes and ventures into Henry and Muriel's apartment during their dinner engagement with Arthur Wainwright.

title: A Fine Romance
description: Muriel's friend from college, Sylvia Walker, pays her a visit after undergoing a divorce. While left alone with Henry, Sylvia makes advances towards him.

title: Deadline for Henry
description: Arthur Wainwright gives Henry an assignment that requires him to work overnight, which is a huge burden for Henry as he has jury duty. Therefore, Muriel, Jackie and Monroe take turns keeping Henry awake at night.

title: Huey
description: Henry's father, Huey, gets kicked out of his retirement home and is thinking of venturing out on his own. Meanwhile, Jackie is considering moving to New York for a new job opportunity.

title: Up Your Easter Bonnet
description: Henry and Muriel go on a skiing trip, which gives Sara the opportunity to offer her parents' apartment to Monroe to stay during Spring Break, as Monroe's parents do not want him to visit.

title: Cosmic Cow vs. the Oval Office
description: Henry loses his job when he writes a satire of Cosmic Cow and Nancy Reagan fixing the country's problems. To combat the salary loss, Muriel takes a job and the Rush's deal with the role reversal.

title: The Return of Rafkin
description: The Rush's hire a medium to conduct a séance for Miss Rafkin, as she thinks her late brother is trying to communicate with her from the other side.

title: Your Guest Is as Good as Mine
The Prince and the Frog
description: A guy who was pursuing Jackie years ago comes back town. And when Jackie learns this, she makes herself scarce. When he arrives and when Sara meets him and is amazed at how great he looks, makes a play for him. They go out and when Jackie learns of this, she's upset.

title: What's Our Rush?
description: Henry and Muriel decide not to find out what the gender of their baby is. But Henry's father wants to know. So he drags Monroe with him to help him break into the doctor's office to find out.

title: Rafkin's Bum
description: A bum shows up and says that he and their previous tenant were close. But he appears not to know that their tenant was a transvestite. And they don't tell him. When he leaves something behind they bring it back to him and discover that he's also keeping a secret.

title: The Remaking of Monroe
description: Sara comes home from a concert angry at Monroe because he didn't stand up to someone who took their seats. She takes him to an assertiveness training class which does wonders for his self-confidence but it also makes him pushy, arrogant and rude to the point that he is told never to set foot in the Rush home again.

title: A Policeman's Wife Is Not a Happy One
Do You Take This Woman Again?
Who Was That Baby I Saw You With?
To Buy or Not to Buy
A Portrait of Henry
description: Henry is upset with Monroe after he accidentally damages the living room wall while hanging a self-portrait of Henry. He chases Monroe out the door, causing him to fall down a flight of stairs. While Monroe is sent to the hospital, Henry is racked with guilt after his conscience starts speaking to him through the portrait.

title: Home Is Where the Bart Is
Is There a Doctor in the House?
Devereaux & Son
description: Ehe Rushes' friend Paul pretends to be a member of their family to impress his long-lost son.

title: Reconcilable Differences
description: Henry and Muriel end up in counseling thanks to the strain of helping another couple settle a squabble.

title: The Two Faces of Muriel
description: Muriel considers cosmetic surgery to revive Henry's interest in her.

title: For Every Man, There's Two Women
description: Monroe is kidnapped and raped by two women in a van. When the police dismiss Monroe's story, Henry searches for the rapists himself.

title: These Stupid Things Remind Me of You
The British Are Coming, the British Are Coming
Arrivederci, Jackie
description: Jackie's been offered a job working at The House of Aldo, an Italian designer but she doesn't tell her father about it. She invites Senor Aldo to the house and still not telling Henry who he is. When the man tells Henry he wants Jackie for his House he thinks he's a dirty old man so he throws him out. Later he is told the truth and Jackie can't believe what he did so she decides to move out. Henry calls the man and tries to apologize and asks him to give Jackie a chance but the man doesn't think it would be good for Jackie because of how overprotective he is. Henry then tries to talk to Jackie and apologize to her.

title: Ars Gratia Iris
description: Henry's married pal chases Muriel's friend.

title: Freddie Loves It, We Love It, You're Cancelled
Garfield the Cat Joins the Marin Bugler
Henry Gets Taken for a Ride
